image.altText: Michelle and Phil Dodunski sit shoulder-to-shoulder

items.synopsis: The parents of a young man who was killed while working on a gas drilling rig 10 years ago say waiting to get answers has been like torture.

title.children: Gareth was crushed to death in a drilling rig tragedy. His parents had to wait a decade for answers

image.altText: people holding fishing rods and fishing at a beach

items.synopsis: Data from the Bureau of Meteorology shows the mean temperature across the country this winter was 1.53 degrees Celsius above the long-term average.

title.children: Australia experiences its warmest winter since national records began in 1910

image.altText: tablets roll out of a jar

items.synopsis: Changes to the PBS that come into effect today could save people with chronic health conditions a lot of time and money. Here's why

title.children: New pharmacy rules come into effect today. Here's how they will impact shoppers

image.altText: Malcom Turnbull, Tanya Plibersek, Allegra Spender, and Lucy Turnbull take a selfie wearing "Yes" campaign shirts.

items.synopsis: As spring 2023 arrives and the referendum campaign begins, it's a far more treacherous landscape for Prime Minister Anthony Albanese than he imagined on election night, writes Annabel Crabb.

title.children: As Malcolm Turnbull took to the train station, the temperature of the Voice debate reached new levels

image.altText: A side-by-side comparison of the moon's surface with the second image showing a new crater

items.synopsis: New images of the surface of the Moon released by NASA show a 10-metre wide crater at the likely impact site of the Russian spacecraft.

title.children: Russia's failed spacecraft Luna-25 left a crater on the Moon, NASA says

image.altText: A person with a hood on uses a mobile phone as the sit at an advanced computer set up.

items.synopsis: Digicel Pacific's network resources are likely being used by private spy firms to track unsuspecting people on the other side of the world and steal their call, message and location data, according to an expert cybersecurity analysis.

title.children: 'Blatant and malicious': Telstra-owned Digicel Pacific used by spies-for-hire, cyber security analysis shows

image.altText: Fillipino map

items.synopsis: China's neighbours have "resolutely rejected" the map in what is the latest dispute in a long-running conflict over the South China Sea.

title.children: Why a U-shaped line on China's latest map is causing protests across Asia

image.altText: Police at the scene of a fatal accident on the Hume Freeway near Chiltern in north-east Victoria

items.synopsis: A truck collision has claimed the lives of two NSW couples aged in their 70s, continuing a horror year for road crashes in Victoria's north.

title.children: Two roadtripping couples killed in Hume Freeway crash had just stopped for a coffee and a rest

image.altText: international students: Graduating

items.synopsis: A COVID-era visa that allowed more than 20,000 international students to work an unlimited amount of hours is being phased out, the federal government has said.

title.children: Immigration minister scraps pandemic visa for international students

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

items.synopsis: An Adelaide court heard the victim was 15 years old when police officer Jordan Lloyd Koch sexually assaulted her, after he engaged in grooming behaviour including sexualised comments.

title.children: Police officer jailed for sexually assaulting teenage girl

image.altText: A man and a pregnant woman stand outside, looking sombre.

items.synopsis: Daniel Buckley's wife will give birth in four weeks and they are still living in a shed after last year's floods. With an insurance premium seven times what it used to be, they will be "queuing up to have a say" as part of a federal inquiry into the sector.

title.children: 'In a headlock': Dad-to-be fuming after insurer's bid to raise premium to level of his mortgage payment

image.altText: A green bird with yellow and red and bright blue wings sitting on a branch.

items.synopsis: Native bird species went on a breeding frenzy during the Murray River flood and increased flows from upstream are feeding even more new life.

title.children: Bird breeding boom as Murray River flood plains explode with colour

image.altText: The tails of Qantas planes showing the flying kangaroo pass each other at Sydney Airport.

items.synopsis: The government's decision to block Qatar Airways from adding more weekly flights prevented airfares from being made cheaper, says the boss of the competition watchdog, as Labor's president backs a review of the government's decision.

title.children: Allowing Qatar to add flights to compete with Qantas would have reduced airfares, says competition watchdog

image.altText: A collection of credit cards.

items.synopsis: Ashlee Frost, 35, has been sentenced to more than three years behind bars after stealing from a pharmaceutical giant and posing as a travel agent and selling travel credits that didn't exist.

title.children: Woman who 'exploited' COVID pandemic to carry out elaborate scam jailed for three years

image.altText: A young woman stands next to a red car in a car dealership.

items.synopsis: In a landmark case for the Australian automotive industry, the Federal Court has ruled Mercedes-Benz is free to set fixed prices and sell direct to customers, rather than let dealerships haggle, write Vishal Mehrotra and Rajat Roy.

title.children: The days of haggling at car dealerships may soon be over, thanks to this landmark legal decision

image.altText: Marles stands in front of a military aircraft speaking to media.

items.synopsis: The defence minister says he wants to clear the air over $3 million worth of taxpayer funded flights charged by his office since April last year, but can't for security reasons.

title.children: Defence Minister Richard Marles defends $3 million spend on taxpayer-funded RAAF flights

image.altText: Three people wearing jackets walking among a crowd man smiling on the right, man using a megaphone in the middle, US flag behind

items.synopsis: Two ex-members of the far-right US group are the first to be sentenced for their roles in the US Capitol riots, apologising in court, with one saying he "was seduced by the crowd".

title.children: 'I lost track of what matters': Seduced by Donald Trump's election lies, Proud Boys leaders given long jail sentences

image.altText: Four men in handcuffs stand with sheriff's officers outside a yellow brick building

items.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge sentences four men to at least a decade each behind bars for the brutal killing of a man they believed had left a series of bad reviews on social media about their gang and drug trade.

title.children: High school killers to spend decade behind bars over bashing death of Victor Codea

image.altText: Teagan Ferguson in a wheelchair

items.synopsis: A West Australian man, who was jailed almost two decades ago for causing catastrophic injuries to his young daughter, has been jailed again for his actions — this time for causing her death.

title.children: Father jailed for causing catastrophic injuries to two-year-old daughter that led to her death 15 years later

image.altText: Man with gun stands on war tank

items.synopsis: A man allegedly tried to sell US-made technology to a Russian company that supplies Russia's weapons makers with electronics.

title.children: Man charged with attempting to sell US tech to Russia for 'Putin's brutal war machine'

image.altText: View of flats in Hillbrow in a dilapidated block where people are struggling with basic services.

items.synopsis: The blaze that ripped through a "hijacked" building in Johannesburg has been labelled one of the deadliest fires in South Africa's history. Here's why these apartment blocks run by criminal gangs are so dangerous.

title.children: One of South Africa's deadliest fires ripped through a 'hijacked' building. Here's why they're so dangerous

image.altText: Robert Cooke, Paul Hunt, Simon Darke and Paul Reynolds.

items.synopsis: A Hobart coroner who investigated the deaths of four police officers who took their own lives recommends Tasmania Police conduct mandatory half-yearly well-being screenings of all operational police officers for PTSD.

title.children: Six-monthly PTSD welfare checks urged after inquest into four police suicide deaths

image.altText: The body of a large crocodile on a riverbank.

items.synopsis: For months, locals and rangers have been discovering the bodies of crocodiles along the Norman River, including as recently as yesterday. Authorities are investigating the "disgusting" crimes.

title.children: At least 14 crocodiles found shot, some beheaded, in Gulf of Carpentaria

image.altText: Person holding a guitar standing in front of a mic

items.synopsis: Band members and fans express their heartbreak over the loss of the guitarist, famously known for playing at the Brothers in Arms tour in 1985.

title.children: Dire Straits' former guitarist Jack Sonni dead at 68

image.altText: Millions of dead fish floating on the Darling River at Menindee on a sunny autumn day

items.synopsis: Water management is in the spotlight after the NSW Chief Scientist's office handed down its findings and recommendations into a mass fish kill in Menindee.

title.children: Tens of millions of fish ran out of air in a major NSW river. A scientist says that is just the start of its problems

image.altText: Boy with cuts on his face and bruising on his eyes

items.synopsis: An investigation is underway after a six-year-old boy was bitten by a support dog at his South Coast school, with reports he was attempting to give the labradoodle a cuddle.

title.children: Labradoodle support dog attacks boy's face during school visit

image.altText: A man with a beard

items.synopsis: An extreme body modifier who implanted a snowflake shape in a woman's hand, leading to her death, has appealed against his 10-year jail sentence, arguing that consent was not considered during sentencing.

title.children: NSW body modifier appeals against 'excessive' sentence after being found guilty of manslaughter and genital mutilation

image.altText: Fetalaiga Pauga dives

items.synopsis: The Sydney Roosters beat South Sydney Rabbitohs to keep their NRL finals hopes alive. Follow all the action in our live ScoreCentre.

title.children: NRL Live: Roosters end Rabbitohs season, keeping their hopes alive

image.altText: A male tennis player holds his arms out, gestuing annoyance, holding a racquet in one hand and ball in the other

items.synopsis: Third seed Daniil Medvedev has fumed over crowd chanting at the US Open during his win over Australian Chris O'Connell.

title.children: 'Can you guys shut up': Medvedev continues long running battle with US Open crowds

image.altText: A person draws a syringe of Pfizer coronavirus vaccine in Perth, WA.

items.synopsis: The nation's top vaccine advisory group has recommended a second 2023 COVID-19 booster dose for vulnerable Australians.

title.children: ATAGI recommends additional COVID jab for vulnerable Australians

image.altText: A necklace made from long spiky quills sits on a white background

items.synopsis: An Aboriginal elder whose handcrafted jewellery was stolen from an exhibition space on Hobart's eastern shore says she was gobsmacked to learn about the theft.

title.children: Aboriginal artist 'gobsmacked' by theft of 'unique' $5k echidna quill necklace

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art
